image.altText: The ACT Supreme Court towards dusk.

props.synopsis: The court heard the 28-year-old travelled straight from a jail in Sydney to assault his ex-partner, in breach of a family violence order.

title.children: Released Long Bay jail inmate who travelled to Canberra to rape ex partner given 10-year sentence

image.altText: A young girl shoots a basketball on an indoor court

props.synopsis: After-school activities can offer physical and mental health benefits, improved resilience and better academic performance, but how can families balance these with the time and financial costs?

title.children: Extracurricular activities provide big benefits to kids – but how much is too much?

image.altText: A schoolboy and an elderly lady smile at the camera side by side.

props.synopsis: Much like ABC TV's award-winning series 'Old People's Home for Teenagers', a weekly initiative at Club Kalina in Canberra is offering students the opportunity to develop social bonds while contributing in a meaningful way to their local community — and it's been a resounding success.

title.children: How school kid Mason became friends with Helen, who lives with dementia

image.altText: Fears Tasmania left exposed after AFP officers removed from Hobart's airport

props.synopsis: AFP officers have walked off the job at seven major airports around the country as part of ongoing industrial action.

title.children: AFP officers walked off the job from seven major airports, but didn't make their action public due to security concerns

image.altText: A grass strip next to a road with multiple bouquets of flowers and a wooden cross.

props.synopsis: The ACT Children's Court heard the 15-year-old boy accused of driving a stolen car that crashed and fatally injured another teenager near State Circle in April has allegedly been on a crime spree in the four months since.

title.children: Canberra teenager who allegedly drove stolen car involved in fatal crash denied bail

image.altText: A woman with shoulder length blonde hair in an orange sweater holds a mug that reads "straight outta Tuggers".

props.synopsis: Growth in Canberra has shifted to the north and west in recent years, and the Tuggeranong area is not predicted to expand. So what can residents who've already made this southern suburb their home expect?

title.children: This area is set to have zero per cent population growth. What does that mean for its residents?

image.altText: Stephen Mitchell sits at a cafe holding a take-away coffee cup.

props.synopsis: A judge who calculated former national rock climbing coach Stephen Mitchell's sentence for child sex abuse on a maximum sentence much higher than what applied at the time of the offences is urged to maintain the over 13-year sentence anyway.

title.children: Canberra judge urged to maintain convicted child sex offender's 13-year sentence

image.altText: The exterior of the court, showing the sign and the crest.

props.synopsis: 62-year-old Stipe Antunovic is accused of driving the woman from a shopping mall to a park, where the woman told police she'd been sexually assaulted.

title.children: Canberra man released on bail after allegedly raping a woman, then stealing her shopping

image.altText: A woman in a race wheelchair

props.synopsis: This year's Paralympics play host to more female athletes than ever before — but putting together quotas and prioritising medal events has been described as "the biggest jigsaw puzzle".

title.children: Upcoming Paris Paralympics are the most gender-inclusive games in the competition’s 64-year history

props.synopsis: Kidnapped from his Burkina Faso home at gunpoint in 2016, Ken Elliott survived seven years in the desert as a prisoner of Al Qaeda.

title.children: Australian doctor who survived seven years in the desert as a prisoner of Al Qaeda speaks for the first time

image.altText: A composite image of Rachel McCrow and Matthew Arnold dressed in police uniforms.

props.synopsis: The families of Constables Rachel McCrow and Matthew Arnold tell an inquest into their deaths they are "forever broken".

title.children: Family of slain police officer say her final message was withheld from them for months

image.altText: Jim Chalmers at podium

props.synopsis: Jim Chalmers says the government was trying to avoid a backlash against the LGBTIQ community when it decided not to proceed with adding questions about sexuality and gender to the census.

title.children: Chalmers says decision not to include LGBTIQ questions in the census was about avoiding 'nastiness'

image.altText: Anthony Albanese holding a takeaway coffee laughs with Kurt Campbell.

props.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese has bridled at questions from journalists about a private conversation where he joked with US Deputy Secretary of State Kurt Campbell about splitting the cost of the Pacific Policing Initiative announced yesterday in Tonga.

title.children: Albanese caught on camera joking about Pacific policing plan with top US official

image.altText: Robert Ovadia wearing a suit with a tie

props.synopsis: A lawyer representing the Seven network says 13 more women had come forward with complaints in relation to former employee Robert Ovadia.

title.children: Thirteen more women make complaints against former Seven journalist Robert Ovadia, court told

image.altText: Woman and man in black suit talk at desk with microphones.

props.synopsis: ASX tipped to open lower, Qantas records large fall in profits as a parliamentary banking inquiry begins. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: Commonwealth Bank, Westpac face questioning in parliamentary inquiry

image.altText: Jacqui Lambie 2024-08-29 10:08:00

props.synopsis: Tasmanian senator Jacqui Lambie says her experiment in state politics has come to an end and apologises to Premier Jeremy Rockliff for the "instability" her party has caused.

title.children: Lambie apologises to premier for instability, says she won't run any more Tasmanian state candidates

image.altText: Broken Tooth 2

props.synopsis: The Queensland government has endorsed a casino owner's side venture with an associate of one of the world's most notorious gangsters.

title.children: Queensland government backs casino side venture with Chinese triad associate

image.altText: Luxor Obelisk, DJ Myd and Australia's flagbearers

props.synopsis: The French colours are everywhere you look for the opening ceremony, a local DJ gets his playlist spot on, and the Australians are worth the wait when they hit the Champs-Élysées. Here are your quick hits from Paris.

title.children: Paralympic quick hits: The Games turn red white and blue, DJ Myd rules the dance floor, and Aussies make it in style

image.altText: A man's legs, wearing a military uniform and boots, standing on a flag on the ground.

props.synopsis: A former Wagner Group mercenary sheds light on the organisation's inner workings, as well as its training and recruitment procedures as the private army announces it has pulled out of Ukraine.

title.children: Former Wagner soldier details horrors of Putin's 'meat grinder' as group pulls out of Ukraine

image.altText: CFMEU MEMBERS RALLY BRISBANE

props.synopsis: Affiliation and donations to the ALP have been suspended, administrators forced in, and now Labor is using the bad stench around the CFMEU as a political weapon against the Greens.

title.children: A Greens MP's CFMEU antics call up memories of Tony Abbott standing in front of 'Ditch the Witch' placards

image.altText: A soldier holding a big gun runs across a sandy road in front of an armoured vehicle.

props.synopsis: At least nine Palestinians have been killed in Israeli raids and strikes on several towns in the north of the occupied West Bank, according to a Red Crescent spokesperson.

title.children: Nine Palestinians killed in Israeli raids and strikes on West Bank, humanitarian workers say

image.altText: Richard Marles National Press Club speech

props.synopsis: The defence minister requested a second office be opened for ministerial duties, just a three-minute walk from his electorate office.

title.children: Defence Minister Richard Marles opened $600k second office despite already having one three minutes away

image.altText: A pair of pink ski on a grassy hill, snow-covered mountains in the background

props.synopsis: The recent hot spell may feel unfamiliar, but weather extremes are quickly becoming the norm, as climate change up-ends the winter seasons.

title.children: As Australia basks in sunshine, ski fields turn to sludge in heatwave labelled a 'hot mess' by climate scientists

image.altText: Latrell Mitchell sits in the stands

props.synopsis: Latrell Mitchell has learnt his fate as both the NRL and the South Sydney Rabbitohs handed down their respective punishments for the controversial white powder photo which circulated on social media earlier this year.

title.children: 'This will be a turning point': NRL and Rabbitohs hand Latrell Mitchell one-match ban and fines over white powder photo

image.altText: Aivi Luik walks in a tracksuit

props.synopsis: Matildas star Aivi Luik saw her world crash down around her after being found guilty of a doping violation before the Paris Olympics. She wants to use her experience as a warning to other athletes.

title.children: 'It made my heart drop': Matildas star warns other athletes after revealing doping ban

image.altText: High waves are observed along the shore as a typhoon approaches.

props.synopsis: A typhoon lashes southern Japan with torrential rain and strong winds, causing at least three deaths as it starts a crawl up the length of the archipelago and raises concerns of flooding, landslides and extensive damage.

title.children: Typhoon Shanshan makes landfall in Japan, leaving three dead and several injured

image.altText: A bald middle-aged man looks with his brow furrowed at another man in a courtroom

props.synopsis: Robert Telles killed investigative journalist Jeff German in a stabbing that rocked Las Vegas and the United States. He will now spend at least 20 years in prison for the murder.

title.children: A reporter's stories led to the end of a politician's career. Two years later, one of them was convicted for murdering the other

image.altText: Illuminated light bulb strands

props.synopsis: Australia's power market operator says the outlook has improved for the country's biggest grid, but the risks of delays to new projects loom large.

title.children: Immediate threat of summer blackouts eases but market operator warns risks remain

image.altText: A graduate holds on to his hat while talking on his mobile phone

props.synopsis: The federal government's proposal to cap international student enrolments has prompted dire warnings from parts of the sector about the economic fallout.

title.children: Universities warn international student cap could slash numbers further than intended

image.altText: A man looks up wearing a black hat, glasses and a blue long sleeve shirt.

props.synopsis: The nine-month-old baby was with his family at Hanlon Park around midday on Tuesday, when it's alleged an unknown man approached them and poured hot liquid on the baby.

title.children: Police release new photos in search for man after hot coffee poured on baby at Brisbane park

image.altText: People wearing winter gear looking at equipment

props.synopsis: The permafrost is melting and scientists are racing to collect ancient viruses trapped in the ice to understand how they’ve adapted to shifting climate over millennia.

title.children: Scientists discover 1,700 new  'zombie' viruses in ancient permafrost in the Himalayas

image.altText: Chris Minns stands at a lecturn

props.synopsis: New South Wales' premier Chris Minns has stopped short of promising to fast-track the approval of any updated plans for a stalled gold mine in the state's central west.

title.children: Future of major new NSW gold mine project hangs in balance as premier says there are no guarantees

image.altText: A mosquiton on the skin of a human host

props.synopsis: How you can avoid contracting sloth fever when travelling to countries experiencing small outbreaks of the mosquito-borne disease.

title.children: Several countries are experiencing 'sloth fever' outbreaks but the chance of it spreading to Australia is low

image.altText: Illustration of a crocodile underwater taking a bite of a dugong

props.synopsis: The "fragmentary skeleton" found in north-western Venezuela showed deep bite marks around the snout.

title.children: Prehistoric dugong found with bite marks from ancient crocodile's 'death roll' and tiger shark scavenging
